channel.title: Skipkpker
channel.description: How do i make valid characters like .,/;'l]]'; Stuff like that not work?

item.title: Skipkpker
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Well since that is in client class, correct? The thread runs, and since it’s going to disconnect them anyways, you just wasted the thread, for no point.

When you can check the connection first, and save the trouble, reducing a bit of lag, but that is better than that way, and the correct way i may add.

Read full topic

item.title: Skipkpker
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

Copied out of dodian

for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){ Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(p != null && !p.disconnected && p.connectedFrom.equals(connectedFrom) && playerId != p.playerId && !connectedFrom.equals("localhost")){ sendMessage("Address in use!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected = true; return; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Skipkpker
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

I already put the shit in your client class, but you told me it didn’t work, i just copied it off dodian, i don’t use it that way.

BUT most of you check the player, during or after the thread for it runs:

if(inStream.readUnsignedByte() != 14) {

Check it when there connecting, less lag.

Also might wanna stop double logger, I guess frugoo would post here, but his way is too long, when actually you only need 1 method.

Read full topic
